newsitem.title: USA: Wall St stocks seen opening higher.
newsitem.headline: Wall St stocks seen opening higher.

text.p: Wall Street stocks were expected to head higher at the opening on Monday, following through on Friday's intraday reversal and late rally.
Analysts said the market would draw its strength in early trading from rallies in European and Asian markets, a steady dollar and a slight improvement in the bond market.

"It looks as though the rally will probably continue," said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments. "We have a steady bond market and a steady dollar so we will probably have a steady opening.
